overview:
Prior to joining FamilyLink.com Tetro was the Chief Marketing Officer for NextPage. In this position, she directed the strategy and execution of NextPageâ€™s product and marketing initiatives. She helped implement and drive the Scrum process as the Product Owner.

Tetro co-founded the Women Tech Council in May 2007 an organization that now has almost a 1000 people involved. Prior to NextPage she worked at Novell driving the product management for Novell’s directory services. She also co-founded a social media distribution company called Rocky Mountain Vocies in 2006.

In 2008, she was recognized as one of the 30 Women to Watch. For the last six years, she has been recognized as a vSpring Capital Top 100 Venture Entrepreneurs (v|100) and was a finalist in the 2008 American Business Association Best Women Entrepreneur. She also serves as an Advisory Board Member for the BYU eBusiness Center and the National Society for New Communications.

She also sits on the board for MountainWest Capital Network, Utah Student 25, the nomination committee for the Wayne Brown Institute and the Community Alliance.

Cydni holds a masterâ€™s degree in business administration and a bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science from Brigham Young University.
